critique: The document primarily aims to convey a sense of progress and inclusivity by updating the name of the committee and expanding its membership. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy, stemming from the positive change and recognition of people with intellectual disabilities. There might be a slight element of surprise due to the changes, but overall, the document focuses on positive emotions. There is no indication of sadness, fear, or disgust. The intensity of joy is moderate, as the document is formal and not overly expressive.
